perturbation.original_text:
ALL DISPUTES ARISING OUT OF THIS AGREEMENT SHALL BE SETTLED VIA BINDING ARBITRATION ACCORDING TO THE RULES
AND REGULATIONS SET FORTH BY THE AMERICAN ARBITRATION ASSOCIATION IN SAN DIEGO COUNTY , THE STATE OF
CALIFORNIA.
perturbation.changed_text: ALL DISPUTES ARISING OUT OF THIS AGREEMENT MAY BE SETTLED VIA ARBITRATION ACCORDING TO INTERNATIONALLY RECOGNIZED PRINCIPLES OF FAIR DISPUTE RESOLUTION WHERE PRACTICABLE.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause mandates binding arbitration according to specific AAA rules in San Diego County, CA. The modified clause replaces 'shall' with 'may,' making arbitration optional. It also substitutes specific AAA rules with vague 'internationally recognized principles of fair dispute resolution' and adds 'where practicable,' creating significant ambiguity. This undermines the enforceability of arbitration. California law favors binding arbitration agreements, and this change could be seen as an attempt to avoid that requirement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Arbitration Act (Cal. Code Civ. Proc. ยง 1280 et seq.)
